00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Wed Mar 15 12:46:53 2006
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Reporter for genotyping probe sets that outputs chp files. There is one
00028  * GCOS XDA CHP file produced for each cel file and the order of the GCOS XDA CHP
00029  * file is guaranteed to be the same as the cdf file. It is very important that
00030  * the number and order of the probeset results is the exact same as the CDF
00031  * file. There have been a number of high impact bugs on this front and it is
00032  * important to be very careful.
00033  */
00034 
00035 #ifndef _QUANTMETHODGTYPECHPREPORT_H_
00036 #define _QUANTMETHODGTYPECHPREPORT_H_
00037 
00038 //
00039 #include "chipstream/AnalysisInfo.h"
00040 #include "chipstream/QuantGTypeMethod.h"
00041 #include "chipstream/QuantMethodReport.h"
00042 //
00043 #include "file/CHPFileBufferWriter.h"
00044 #include "file/CHPFileWriter.h"
00045 #include "util/Util.h"
00046 //
00047 #include <cfloat>
00048 #include <iostream>
00049 //
00050 
00051 class QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport : public QuantMethodReport {
00052 public: 
00053   /** Constructor. */
00054   QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport(AnalysisInfo &chpInfo, 
00055                             const std::string& prefix, 
00056                             const std::string& algName) 
00057   {
00058       m_Info = chpInfo;
00059       m_AlgName = algName;
00060       m_Prefix = prefix;
00061       m_CurrentProbeSetCount = 0;
00062       Err::check(chpInfo.m_ProbesetNames.size() == chpInfo.m_NumProbeSets, 
00063           "Error: QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport() - m_NumProbeSets != m_ProbesetNames.size()");
00064   }
00065 
00066   /** Destructor. */
00067   ~QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport() { }
00068 
00069   /**
00070    * Set the CHP filenames to use for output. This overrides any prefix and allows
00071    * the caller to place the chp files anyplace they are desired.
00072    * @param fileNames - Vector of fileNames with full path to output
00073    * file, one for each cel file.
00074    */
00075   void setChpFileNames(std::vector<std::string> &fileNames) {
00076     m_CHPFileNames = fileNames;
00077   }
00078 
00079   /** 
00080    * Get set up for a run of reporting probesets. Often used to open file
00081    * streams and print headers to files etc.
00082    * 
00083    * @param qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
00084    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00085    * 
00086    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00087    */
00088   bool prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart);
00089 
00090   /** 
00091    * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00092    * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00093    * 
00094    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00095    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00096    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00097    * 
00098    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00099    */
00100   bool report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00101               QuantMethod &qMethod,
00102               const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00103               std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00104               PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00105 
00106   
00107   /** 
00108    * For genotyping CHP files GTYPE likes to have the median of the raw intensity
00109    * probes stuffed into the confidence field of the CHP files. I'm not sure why
00110    * but Richard C asked for it so here it is.
00111    * 
00112    * @param psGroup - Groupt of probes.
00113    * @param iMart - Raw intensity data for chips.
00114    * @param chipIx - Which chip we are taking the median for.
00115    * 
00116    * @return median of all raw intensities for the PM probes in psGroup.
00117    */
00118   float medianOfPmProbes(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, int chipIx);
00119 
00120   /** 
00121    * If a probeset fails to compute for whatever reason then this method is
00122    * called rather than the normal report call above. By default does nothing.
00123    * 
00124    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00125    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00126    * 
00127    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00128    */
00129    bool reportFailure(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00130                       QuantMethod &qMethod, 
00131                       const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00132                       std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00133                       PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00134 
00135   /** 
00136    * No more probesets will be processed, this is a chance to finish outputting
00137    * results and clean up.
00138    * @param qMethod - Quantification method that was used.
00139    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00140    */
00141   bool finish(QuantMethod &qMethod);
00142   
00143 private:
00144 
00145   /** Swap out the .cel for .chp */
00146   void setupFileNames(const IntensityMart &iMart);
00147 
00148   /** Fill in a chp header file info. */
00149   void setupChpFile(affxchpwriter::CCHPFileWriter &chp, AnalysisInfo &info);
00150 
00151   /// Our prefix to filenames, often a path.
00152   std::string m_Prefix;
00153 
00154   /// Our algorithm name. Will be appended before .chp, i.e. mycel.cel-> mycel.algName.chp
00155   std::string m_AlgName;
00156 
00157   /// How many probesets have we seen this far?
00158   int m_CurrentProbeSetCount;
00159   /// Use for writing signals to a buffer. When the buffer is full, write it to CHP files.
00160   affxchpwriter::CCHPFileBufferWriter m_GenotypeEntryBufferWriter;
00161   /// Names of all of our cel files
00162   std::vector<std::string> m_CELFileNames;
00163   /// Names of all of our chp files, one for each cel file.
00164   std::vector<std::string> m_CHPFileNames;
00165   std::vector<std::string> m_FilesForWriter;
00166   /// All the infomation about our algorithm, etc.
00167   AnalysisInfo m_Info;
00168 };
00169 
00170 #endif /* _QUANTMETHODGTYPECHPREPORT_H_ */
